From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure the current session to refuse to negotiate full-duplex, remote echo options on incoming connections, use the **terminal telnet refuse-negotiations** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: In the following example, the current session is configured to refuse full-duplex, remote echo requests:
ExtraInfo: You can set the line to allow access server to refuse full-duplex, remote echo connection requests from the other end. This command suppresses negotiation of the Telnet Remote Echo and Suppress Go Ahead options.
